results.title: The North has changed
results.brief_description: Once remote from the world’s mineral markets, the Canadian North is rapidly changing. This film shows what is happening as government and private interests work to develop the North’s mineral resources and to build the roads, railways and airfields that will bring the wealth to market. One new frontiersman seen in the film is a young geologist whose company in Japan seeks the North’s copper.

results.title: The North east: Port of New York
results.creator_credit: George Silano, Alan Seeger, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: The Port of New York is a pivotal trade centre, geographically, in world trade. Economically it is the busiest harbour in the world and illustrates the dependence of nations upon the exchange of goods.

results.title: The North = El Norte
results.creator_credit: Gregory Nava, Anna Thomas, Channel 4, American Playhouse Theatrical Films and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: A moving look at war-torn Guatemala and the plight of illegal aliens through the eyes of a young brother and sister. They move ‘north’ to America, for a life of freedom and happiness but as illegal immigrants their dreams quickly crumble and it will take everything they’ve got to survive the harsh reality of city life. Cast includes Zaide Silvia Gutierrez, David Villalpando, Ernesto Gomez Cruz, and Alicia del Lago.

results.title: The Norman Gunston show 3
results.creator_credit: Simon Francis and Total Film & Television
results.brief_description: The Norman Gunston show volume three, features highlights from the television series “The Norman Gunston show”, aired in 1993. Comedian Garry McDonald appears in character as Norman Gunston, a guileless interviewer and performer with a variety/entertainment show. Interviewees on this disc include: Ian Botham, Lionel Ritchie, David Faustino, Tim Allen, Dolph Lundgren and two members of the rock band Guns n Roses. At the opening of David Williamson’s new play, Gunston interviews Michael York, Michael Gross and the playwright. Also features one song from music group Mahotella Queens as well as Gunston’s musical rendition of “Unforgettable”.

results.title: The Norman Gunston show 1
results.creator_credit: Simon Francis and Total Film & Television
results.brief_description: The Norman Gunston show volume one features highlights from the television series “The Norman Gunston show”, aired in 1993. Comedian Garry McDonald appears in character as Norman Gunston, a guileless interviewer and performer with a variety/entertainment show. Interviewees on this disc include: Sylvania Waters, Billy Crystal, Jackie Collins, Anthony Lapaglia and Corbin Bernsen. Includes a musical number from Australian pop band, Girlfriend, and Gunston’s comedic renditions of the hit songs, “Simply irresistible” and “I Will always love you”, the Dolly Parton/Whitney Houston ballad. One segment features Gunston at a rave, interviewing teenage patrons, discussing with them the dangers of drugs.

results.title: The Norman conquests. Part 3. Round and round the garden
results.creator_credit: Herbert Wise, David Susskind, Verity Lambert and Thames Television
results.brief_description: Based on Alan Ayckbourn’s West End trilogy “The Norman conquests” and adapted for television, part three of the trilogy, “Round and round the garden” sees most of the drama set in the garden with a furtive Norman (Tom Conti) doing his best to spirit Annie away, Reg and Tom speculating on Norman’s secretive love-life and Ruth (Norman’s wife) happily sunbathing. The trilogy takes place over a weekend in the family’s country house and features the same six characters in each play. Each story is played out through different eyes but the three plays together form the whole picture. Complex plot but contains some wonderful moments of wit and humour. Stars Richard Briers, Penelope Keith, David Troughton, Fiona Walker, Penelope Wilton.

results.title: The Norman conquests. Part 2. Living together
results.creator_credit: Herbert Wise, David Susskind, Verity Lambert and Thames Television
results.brief_description: Based on Alan Ayckbourn’s West End trilogy “The Norman conquests” and adapted for television, part two of the trilogy, “Living together” sees the irrepressible Norman (Tom Conti) continuing his pursuit of the various women in his family including his sister-in-law, his brother-in-law’s wife and his own wife. The trilogy takes place over a weekend in the family’s country house and features the same six characters in each play. Each story is played out through different eyes but the three plays together form the whole picture. Complex plot but contains some wonderful moments of wit and humour. Stars Richard Briers, Penelope Keith, David Troughton, Fiona Walker, Penelope Wilton.

results.title: The Normal stomach: fluoroscopic observations
results.creator_credit: Norman Schenker, Association of American Medical Colleges and Medical Audio-Visual Institute
results.brief_description: Shows by means of cinefluorography, peristalsis, normal tonus, hypertonus, and hypotonus, and the pumping motion of the stomach’s contents.

results.title: The Normal neonate (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Examination of a normal infant by a leading paediatrician. It encompasses the six stages of consciousness, the senses of sight and hearing, gross motor functions, and the primitive reflexes.
